article.title: Xopus in a CMS
article.introduction: â€‹When placing Xopus in a CMS, there are numerous ways to do this. The following options are common:

section.title: Xopus in an iframe
section.paragraph: When using Xopus in an iframe, such as here, it is easy to load new documents.
Xopus detects that it is running in an iframe and therefore shows the maximize icon in the top right corner of the toolbar.

section.title: Xopus around everything
section.paragraph: When you place Xopus around a complete system you can create make parts of the page editable using an 'island'. Any HTML placed outside the 'island' (discussed in the next document) is rendered as usual.

section.title: Xopus on a new page
section.paragraph: By placing Xopus on a new page, it may be easy to open and close, but Xopus will need to restart all the time. Using an iframe and keeping Xopus open is a better solution.
